column4: has any one else had any problems after they updated? like "/bin/sh; can't access tty; job control turned off - and it wont let them get past the damn annoying black screen
not had that problem yet with today's updates of libgsf and xine.
well, you can goto the store and buy a copy of windows with a windows license.
I forget the price but windows home retail is like 95USD
that's great and all. But if you don't have a windows cd, you're not going to be able to install windows.
yet you're on IRC right now...
well, what's the problem with ubuntu currently?
login and type startx.
type the command 'startx'
okay.. type in 'apt-get install ubuntu-desktop' this should download the default ubuntu desktop  and so on.
# is fine. It just means you're logged in as root.
okay.. you don't even have the ubuntu base installed...
what the hell happened?
'cd /' then 'ls'
there is no /home folder ?
'ls /dev/hd*' ?
type in 'bash', then try 'ls /dev/hd*' again
well, to be honest. What happened to your system baffles me, it's like someone puposely got into it, configured it that way and removed all the useful utilities.
gah.. You have no logs. Would you happen to have the ubuntu cd on you?
I take it he installed ubuntu and so on?
you really need to get the ubuntu cd or get your ex to help you. :/
